* handles different potential formats of datetime input
* @throws EmptyDeadlineDateException if split desc string has < 2 parts(no date)
public Deadlines(String desc) throws EmptyDeadlineException, EmptyDeadlineDateException {
//throw exception if task desc not given

// input of format 2020-12-10 || 10/12/2020 changed to Dec 12 2020

* Returns date of deadline task in LocalDate type

* or second part(start time) or third part(end time) is empty
public Events(String desc) throws EmptyEventException, EmptyEventTimingException {
("      OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty leh.");
// Split the description to extract the timings

//throw exception if end time not given or it is whitespace

* Returns string representation of task completion status

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
return desc; // mark done task with X

assertEquals("[D][ ] read book (by: Apr 10 2020, 4:00 PM)", new Deadlines("read book /by 2020-04-10 16:00").print());
assertEquals("     OOPS!! Deadline date not given leh!", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("     OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty leh.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[E][ ] read book (from: 4pm to: 6pm)", new Events("read book /from 4pm /to 6pm").print());
assertEquals("     OOPS! Event start time not given leh", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("      OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty leh.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[T][ ] read book", new ToDos("read book").print());
assertEquals("    OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty leh.", e.getMessage());
